entry.title: aṅga
entry.span: (l) limb, (2) factor (of path, jhāna, etc.), (3) practice, etc.

entry.title: attha
entry.span: (1) benefit, result, (2) purpose, aim, goal, (3) meaning

entry.title: adinnādāna
entry.span: taking what is not given, stealing

entry.title: *adhikicca
entry.span: as an integral part of, dependent on

entry.title: adhisīla
entry.span: higher virtue (i.e. virtue as basis for jhāna and insight)

entry.title: anuloma
entry.span: (1) in conformity with, (2) in forward order, or as “arising” (of dependent origination), (3) conformity (stage in development of jhāna or insight)

entry.title: abhibhāyatana
entry.span: base of mastery, base for transcending (the sense-desire sphere)

entry.title: arahant
entry.span: arahant (4th and last stage of realization)

entry.title: ariya
entry.span: noble, noble one (i.e. one who has attained a path)

entry.title: *allīyituṃ
entry.span: to give shelter (not in CPD; inf. ā+līyati; see leṇa in CPD): (allīyitabba)

entry.title: avyākata
entry.span: (1) (kammically) indeterminate (i.e. neither profitable nor unprofitable), (2) un-answered (by the Buddha)

entry.title: asekha
entry.span: non-trainer (i.e. one who has reached the fruition of arahantship)

entry.title: ākāra-rūpa
entry.span: matter as mode (e.g. “mark of the female”)

entry.title: iddhipāda
entry.span: road to power, basis for success (the 4)

entry.title: uppatti-bhava
entry.span: rebirth-process becoming, being as result of action

entry.title: *okāseti
entry.span: to scatter on (not as in PED):

entry.title: ojaṭṭhamaka
entry.span: material octad with nutritive essence as eighth

entry.title: *kataka
entry.span: a kind of seed (used for clearing water)

entry.title: kathā-vatthu
entry.span: (1) name of Abhidhamma book, (2) instance of talk (the 10)

entry.title: kalāpa
entry.span: (1) group, (2) material group (term for material octad, etc.)

entry.title: kalāpa-sammasana
entry.span: comprehension by groups (does not refer to the material octad, etc.)

entry.title: kasiṇa
entry.span: kasiṇa, universal (a contemplation device, and concept based thereon)

entry.title: kāma-guṇa
entry.span: cord of sense-desire (the 5), dimension of sensual desire

entry.title: kāya
entry.span: (1) body, group, order, (2) the material body, (3) the mental body (i.e. the 3 nāmakkhandha)

entry.title: kāya-saṅkhāra
entry.span: bodily formation (term for in-breath and out-breath)

entry.title: *koṭṭhaṭṭhi
entry.span: shoulder-blade bone (lit. “flat-bone”; not as in PED):

entry.title: *gata-paccāgata
entry.span: (1) duty of going to and returning from the alms round with the meditation subject, (2) kind of refuse rag:

entry.title: catusamuṭṭhāna
entry.span: (matter) of fourfold origination (i.e. by consciousness, kamma, temperature and nutriment)

entry.title: *cāpalya
entry.span: (this meaning not in CPD, under acāpalya or acapala)

entry.title: citta-saṅkhāra
entry.span: mental formation (term for perception and feeling)

entry.title: cetasika
entry.span: consciousness concomitant (i.e. feeling, perception and formations)

entry.title: ṭhiti
entry.span: (1) presence, (2) station, (3) relation, (4) steadiness, stability, (5) stationariness, stagnation

entry.title: *tadārammaṇa
entry.span: (1) having that (aforesaid thing) as its object, (2) registration (consciousness):

entry.title: tilakkhaṇa
entry.span: three characteristics (of impermanence, pain and not-self)

entry.title: *ti-santati-rūpa
entry.span: materiality of triple continuity (term for the three decads at moment of rebirth-linking):

entry.title: *ti-samuṭṭhāna
entry.span: materiality of triple origination (by kamma, temperature and nutriment only):

entry.title: *theriya
entry.span: belonging to the Elders: epil. verse

entry.title: dassana
entry.span: (l) seeing (the eye’s function), (2) vision, (3) term for the first path

entry.title: *desantar-uppatti
entry.span: successive arising in adjacent locations (description of phenomenon of motion);

entry.title: dvāra
entry.span: door (i.e. the 6 d. of consciousness by the 6 bases; also the 3 d. of kamma by body, speech and mind)

entry.title: dhamma
entry.span: (1) the Dhamma or Law (as discovered by the Buddha), (2) dhamma, state, thing, phenomenon, (3) mental object, mental datum (12th base)

entry.title: dhamma-ṭṭhiti-ñāṇa
entry.span: knowledge of relations of states, knowledge of structure of ideas

entry.title: *dhura-bhatta
entry.span: meal given in a principal house (not as in PED):

entry.title: nāma-kaya
entry.span: mentality body, mental body (aggregates of feeling, perception and formations)

entry.title: nāma-rūpa
entry.span: mentality-materiality (term for the five aggregates, or for the four aggregates excluding consciousness)

entry.title: *nipphanna
entry.span: produced (term for certain kinds of derived materiality)

entry.title: Nibbāna
entry.span: nirvana, extinction (of greed, hate and delusion)

entry.title: niyyāna
entry.span: outlet (from the round of rebirths; term for the path)

entry.title: pakkhandati
entry.span: to enter into, to launch out into

entry.title: paccaya
entry.span: (1) condition (for what is conditionally arisen), (2) requisite (the 4 for the bhikkhu)

entry.title: paccayākāra
entry.span: structure of conditions (term for dependent origination)

entry.title: paññatti
entry.span: (1) making-known, announcement, (2) appellation, designation, (3) concept, description

entry.title: paṭicca
entry.span: (indecl. ger. of paṭiyeti) having depended, due to, dependent on

entry.title: *paṭicca
entry.span: (decl. adj.) ought to be arrived at:

entry.title: papañca
entry.span: (1) obstacle, (2) diffuseness, (2) diversification (as function of craving, conceit and wrong view; not in this sense in PED)

entry.title: *pabhuti
entry.span: encl.) and so on, etcetera ( = ādi in that sense):

entry.title: pariggaha
entry.span: (1) inclusion, (2) embracing (as definition of right speech), (3) reinforcement, (4) discerning, etc.

entry.title: paritta
entry.span: (1) small, (2) limited (term for the sense-desire sphere), (3) protection (term for certain discourses recited for that purpose)

entry.title: *pariveṇa
entry.span: surroundings of a building, surrounding walk:

entry.title: pavatta, pavatti
entry.span: (1) occurrence, (2) course of an existence (between rebirth-linking and death)

entry.title: puthujjana
entry.span: ordinary man (i.e. one who has not

entry.title: phala
entry.span: (1) fruit of (plants), (2) fruit of cause, (3) fruition (of path; the 4)

entry.title: bala
entry.span: power (the 5; the 10 of a Perfect One)

entry.title: brahmacariya
entry.span: life of purity, the good life, the life divine

entry.title: *bhanti
entry.span: they shine (3rd p. pl. of bhāti):

entry.title: bhāvanā
entry.span: (1) development (lit. making be’), (2) term for the 3 higher paths

entry.title: bhūta
entry.span: (1) become, been, (2) creature, (3) primary element (entity) of matter, etc.

entry.title: bhūtūpādā-rūpa
entry.span: matter derived upon the (four) primary elements (the 24 kinds)

entry.title: mahaggata
entry.span: exalted (a term for consciousness “exalted” from the “limited” sense-desire sphere to the fine-material or immaterial spheres)

entry.title: mātikā
entry.span: (1) schedule of the Abhidhamma, (2) codes of the Pātimokkha (the 2), (3) schedule, etc.

entry.title: yathā-kammūpaga-ñāṇa
entry.span: knowledge of (beings’) faring according to deeds

entry.title: rasa
entry.span: (1) taste, flavour, (2) nature as function or achievement, (3) stimulus (for feeling), (4) essential juice, filtrate

entry.title: rūpa
entry.span: (1) materiality (aggregate), fine materiality of fine-material Brahmāworld, matter in general, material form, (2) visible datum, visible object, visible matter, visible form

entry.title: rūpa-rūpa
entry.span: concrete materiality (term for certain derived kinds of materiality)

entry.title: lokiya
entry.span: mundane (i.e. not associated with the path, fruition or Nibbāna)

entry.title: lokuttara
entry.span: supramundane (i.e. the 9 states consisting of the 4 paths, 4 fruitions and Nibbāna, and states associated with them)

entry.title: vaṭṭa
entry.span: round (of kamma, etc.; term for the dependent origination as arising)

entry.title: vatthu
entry.span: (1) basis, physical basis (term for the six internal bases), (2) object, (3) instance, example, (4) story, etc.

entry.title: vikāra-rūpa
entry.span: materiality as alteration (term for certain of the 24 kinds of derived materiality, i.e. impermanence, etc.)

entry.title: vikubbana
entry.span: (1) versatility (in development of divine abidings), (2) transformation (by supernormal power)

entry.title: vinaya
entry.span: (1) Vinaya Piṭaka or Book of Discipline, (2) discipline, removal, leading away

entry.title: vipassanā
entry.span: insight (the vision of what is formed as impermanent, painful, notself)

entry.title: vivaṭṭa
entry.span: (1) cessation of the round (of kamma, etc.), the dependent origination as cessation, (2) turning away, (3) expansion (of world after contraction)

entry.title: vīthi-citta
entry.span: a consciousness of the cognitive series

entry.title: vuṭṭhānagāmini-vipassanā
entry.span: insight leading to emergence (of the path)

entry.title: vedanā
entry.span: feeling (i.e. of pleasure, pain, or neither)

entry.title: vodāna
entry.span: cleansing (term for consciousness preceding absorption or path)

entry.title: satta-saññā
entry.span: (1) perception of a living being, (2) the seven perceptions (first of the 18 principal insights)

entry.title: *sappati
entry.span: to be emitted (pass. of sapati, to swear):

entry.title: samuccheda
entry.span: cutting off (of defilements by the path)

entry.title: *sampatta-visaya
entry.span: having a contiguous objective field (i.e. smell, taste and touch)

entry.title: sāmañña-lakkhaṇa
entry.span: general characteristic (of what is formed, i.e. the 3 beginning with impermanence)

entry.title: sīlabbata
entry.span: rules and vows (Ñāṇamoli’s original translation was “rites and rituals,” but was changed in accordance with his later translation of this term. )

entry.title: sukkha-vipassaka
entry.span: bare(or dry-) insight worker (one who attains the path without previously having attained jhāna)

entry.title: sekha
entry.span: trainer (term for one possessing one of the four paths or first three fruitions, so with training still to do)
